topic.title: ZeroNet Altcoin Exchange
topic.body:
Is anyone interested in working on a ZeroNet altcoin exchange with me? It would have to be entirely not for profit and the actual worth of the coins would have to be calculated by what the ZeroNet users were willing to pay.

If you're interested, please get in touch with me by secure mail - wsmythe

topic.title: Help Registering and Maintaining .bit Domains
topic.body: Do you want a .bit domain but don't have Namecoins or the time to sort it out? Get in touch and I'll help you for nothing more than the cost of the Namecoin in any other cryptocurrency.

2_1BuwB8WTT7SfiTncivoMudckGtswexyP5E.body: i can write an altcoin exchange using client/server infrastructure - but you're right, the issue is that the whole thing has to be self controlling. The blockchain itself allows for in-built escrow and you could end up with system that looks after itself without the need for administration nor profit.
if anyone is interested in discussing this further you can also find me either at wsmythe@zeroid.bit or on Bitmessage on BM-NBexzU3gMzuGkSbnbvcEfWeu48gSxMFe or even TorChat - t7olgf5oikt74hth

I've noticed a few people have expressed interest but not commented - it would be really useful to knock some ideas around even if you aren't that technical. 

This would essentially be a self-sustaining altcoin exchange, with no need for trust, relying entirely on the blockchain for escrow.

If you have any ideas, thoughts or criticisms, please do get in touch either at wsmythe@zeroid.bit or on Bitmessage on BM-NBexzU3gMzuGkSbnbvcEfWeu48gSxMFe or even TorChat - t7olgf5oikt74hth
